`LOC` — Returns the address of a variable

### Description
`LOC(X)` returns the address of `X` as an integer.



### Syntax
`RESULT = LOC(X)`


### Arguments

     
 | `X`  | Variable of any type.






### Return value
The return value is of type `INTEGER`, with a `KIND`corresponding to the size (in bytes) of a memory address on the target
machine.



### Example

     ```


program test_loc

  integer :: i

  real :: r

  i = loc(r)

  print *, i

end program test_loc

```

     

### Standard
GNU extension



### Class
Inquiry function
